title: I call upon those who can get past gold and have wisdom for me please... *OOOOMMMMM*

replies.body: have a brother that's D3 who has a smurf account who can duoboost you

The LP you get will be based on a comparison of your team's MMR and their team's MMR. if you are outmatched you would get more for a win, lose less for a loss.

Sometimes your MMR can be SLIGHTLY higher than your visible rank; in this case your average opponent will be higher.

Your visible rank will always gravitate toward your MMR. In short, it all will work out the way it's supposed to.

> Sometimes your MMR can be SLIGHTLY higher than your visible rank; in this case your average opponent will be higher.
> 
> Your visible rank will always gravitate toward your MMR. In short, it all will work out the way it's supposed to.

Yes and no.
The duality between the MMR and the tier system is inherently flawed. If your MMR is way above your tier you naturally will gain more LP in the tier system. This in itself could work, the big problem here are promo games. In theory some people can tank their MMR so hard that they could go up against people nearly a league above their current rank just because they couldn't manage to win their promo games.

This entire problem could be fixed if the system manually put you at the elo of the tier you'll be put after winning your promo games.
Simply said: If your MMR is gold 2 (extreme imbalance example) and your rank is silver 1 you should have to play against a gold 5 team in your promos instead of a gold 2 team/ or you shouldn't need to win promos at all.

The big complaint about ranked in this regard is that it feels like shit if you have to win way harder promo games than your average player just to achieve the same rank. The difference between tiers in silver isn't that big so it's not that much of a problem in there if you're a more or less consistent player but the higher you go the bigger the skill difference becomes.

Just imagine a plat1 with a diamond 4 elo having to play through an extended dia5-dia4 promo just to enter diamond while the plat1 with a diamond 5 elo has an "easier" Bo5. **The "gateway" to a higher tier should universally be the same which it isn't right now.**

The longer your queue time is actively searching for a match, the more it broadens its specifications.  On the other hand, you shouldn't really be paying attention to their ranks, the skill between S3-S1 and even Gold 5 is so similar that it shouldn't alter your matches. Its more of a mental barrier if anything and could really ruin your proper mindset before the match even starts. 

i get your whole ladder idea, i played Tennis too , and we did things the same way at practice. We could challenge teammates for their spot, 1-3 singles, 1-3 doubles, and the reserve players. But in League this doesn't really work. you would be waiting forever if matchmaking had to search for 10 Silver 3 players everytime you queued, note these players also have different roles selected as preference... There would be a very high auto fill rate, or you would just be waiting for 10min+ everytime.
